057/**
058 * Default implementation of a <a href="http://developers.facebook.com/docs/api">Facebook Graph API</a> client.
059 * 
060 * @author <a href="http://restfb.com">Mark Allen</a>
061 */
062public class DefaultFacebookClient extends BaseFacebookClient implements FacebookClient {
063  public static final String CLIENT_ID = "client_id";
064  public static final String APP_ID = "appId";
065  public static final String APP_SECRET = "appSecret";
066  public static final String SCOPE = "scope";
067  public static final String CANNOT_EXTRACT_ACCESS_TOKEN_MESSAGE = "Unable to extract access token from response.";
068  public static final String PARAM_CLIENT_SECRET = "client_secret";
069  /**
070   * Graph API access token.
071   */
072  protected String accessToken;
073
074  /**
075   * Graph API app secret.
076   */
077  private String appSecret;
078
079  /**
080   * facebook exception generator to convert Facebook error json into java exceptions
081   */
082  private FacebookExceptionGenerator graphFacebookExceptionGenerator;
083
084  /**
085   * holds the Facebook endpoint urls
086   */
087  private FacebookEndpoints facebookEndpointUrls = new FacebookEndpoints() {};
088
089  /**
090   * Reserved "multiple IDs" parameter name.
091   */
092  protected static final String IDS_PARAM_NAME = "ids";
093
094  /**
095   * Version of API endpoint.
096   */
097  protected Version apiVersion;
098
099  /**
100   * By default this is <code>false</code>, so real http DELETE is used
101   */
102  protected boolean httpDeleteFallback;
103
104  protected boolean accessTokenInHeader;
105
106  protected DefaultFacebookClient() {
107    this(Version.LATEST);
108  }
109
110  /**
111   * Creates a Facebook Graph API client with the given {@code apiVersion}.
112   * 
113   * @param apiVersion
114   *          Version of the api endpoint
115   */
116  public DefaultFacebookClient(Version apiVersion) {
117    this(null, null, new DefaultWebRequestor(), new DefaultJsonMapper(), apiVersion);
118  }
119
120  /**
121   * Creates a Facebook Graph API client with the given {@code accessToken}.
122   * 
123   * @param accessToken
124   *          A Facebook OAuth access token.
125   * @param apiVersion
126   *          Version of the api endpoint
127   * @since 1.6.14
128   */
129  public DefaultFacebookClient(String accessToken, Version apiVersion) {
130    this(accessToken, null, new DefaultWebRequestor(), new DefaultJsonMapper(), apiVersion);
131  }
132
133  /**
134   * Creates a Facebook Graph API client with the given {@code accessToken}.
135   * 
136   * @param accessToken
137   *          A Facebook OAuth access token.
138   * @param appSecret
139   *          A Facebook application secret.
140   * @param apiVersion
141   *          Version of the api endpoint
142   * @since 1.6.14
143   */
144  public DefaultFacebookClient(String accessToken, String appSecret, Version apiVersion) {
145    this(accessToken, appSecret, new DefaultWebRequestor(), new DefaultJsonMapper(), apiVersion);
146  }
147
148  /**
149   * Creates a Facebook Graph API client with the given {@code accessToken}.
150   * 
151   * @param accessToken
152   *          A Facebook OAuth access token.
153   * @param webRequestor
154   *          The {@link WebRequestor} implementation to use for sending requests to the API endpoint.
155   * @param jsonMapper
156   *          The {@link JsonMapper} implementation to use for mapping API response JSON to Java objects.
157   * @param apiVersion
158   *          Version of the api endpoint
159   * @throws NullPointerException
160   *           If {@code jsonMapper} or {@code webRequestor} is {@code null}.
161   * @since 1.6.14
162   */
163  public DefaultFacebookClient(String accessToken, WebRequestor webRequestor, JsonMapper jsonMapper,
164      Version apiVersion) {
165    this(accessToken, null, webRequestor, jsonMapper, apiVersion);
166  }
167
168  /**
169   * Creates a Facebook Graph API client with the given {@code accessToken}, {@code webRequestor}, and
170   * {@code jsonMapper}.
171   * 
172   * @param accessToken
173   *          A Facebook OAuth access token.
174   * @param appSecret
175   *          A Facebook application secret.
176   * @param webRequestor
177   *          The {@link WebRequestor} implementation to use for sending requests to the API endpoint.
178   * @param jsonMapper
179   *          The {@link JsonMapper} implementation to use for mapping API response JSON to Java objects.
180   * @param apiVersion
181   *          Version of the api endpoint
182   * @throws NullPointerException
183   *           If {@code jsonMapper} or {@code webRequestor} is {@code null}.
184   */
185  public DefaultFacebookClient(String accessToken, String appSecret, WebRequestor webRequestor, JsonMapper jsonMapper,
186      Version apiVersion) {
187    super();
188
189    verifyParameterPresence("jsonMapper", jsonMapper);
190    verifyParameterPresence("webRequestor", webRequestor);
191
192    this.accessToken = trimToNull(accessToken);
193    this.appSecret = trimToNull(appSecret);
194
195    this.webRequestor = webRequestor;
196    this.jsonMapper = jsonMapper;
197    this.jsonMapper.setFacebookClient(this);
198    this.apiVersion = Optional.ofNullable(apiVersion).orElse(Version.UNVERSIONED);
199    graphFacebookExceptionGenerator = new DefaultFacebookExceptionGenerator();
200  }
201
202  /**
203   * Switch between access token in header and access token in query parameters (default)
204   * 
205   * @param accessTokenInHttpHeader
206   *          <code>true</code> use access token as header field, <code>false</code> use access token as query parameter
207   *          (default)
208   */
209  public void setHeaderAuthorization(boolean accessTokenInHttpHeader) {
210    this.accessTokenInHeader = accessTokenInHttpHeader;
211  }
212
213  /**
214   * override the default facebook exception generator to provide a custom handling for the facebook error objects
215   * 
216   * @param exceptionGenerator
217   *          the custom exception generator implementing the {@link FacebookExceptionGenerator} interface
218   */
219  public void setFacebookExceptionGenerator(FacebookExceptionGenerator exceptionGenerator) {
220    graphFacebookExceptionGenerator = exceptionGenerator;
221  }
222
223  /**
224   * fetch the current facebook exception generator implementing the {@link FacebookExceptionGenerator} interface
225   * 
226   * @return the current facebook exception generator
227   */
228  public FacebookExceptionGenerator getFacebookExceptionGenerator() {
229    return graphFacebookExceptionGenerator;
230  }
231
232  @Override
233  public boolean deleteObject(String object, Parameter... parameters) {
234    verifyParameterPresence("object", object);
235
236    String responseString = makeRequest(object, true, true, null, parameters);
237
238    try {
239      JsonValue jObj = Json.parse(responseString);
240      boolean success = false;
241      if (jObj.isObject()) {
242        if (jObj.asObject().contains("success")) {
243          success = jObj.asObject().get("success").asBoolean();
244        }
245        if (jObj.asObject().contains("result")) {
246          success = jObj.asObject().get("result").asString().contains("Successfully deleted");
247        }
248      } else {
249        success = jObj.asBoolean();
250      }
251      return success;
252    } catch (ParseException jex) {
253      CLIENT_LOGGER.trace("no valid JSON returned while deleting a object, using returned String instead", jex);
254      return "true".equals(responseString);
255    }
256  }
257
258  /**
259   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#fetchConnection(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class, com.restfb.Parameter[])
260   */
261  @Override
262  public <T> Connection<T> fetchConnection(String connection, Class<T> connectionType, Parameter... parameters) {
263    verifyParameterPresence("connection", connection);
264    verifyParameterPresence("connectionType", connectionType);
265    return new Connection<>(this, makeRequest(connection, parameters), connectionType);
266  }
267
268  /**
269   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#fetchConnectionPage(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class)
270   */
271  @Override
272  public <T> Connection<T> fetchConnectionPage(final String connectionPageUrl, Class<T> connectionType) {
273    String connectionJson;
274    if (!isBlank(accessToken) && !isBlank(appSecret)) {
275      WebRequestor.Request request = new WebRequestor.Request(String.format("%s&%s=%s", connectionPageUrl,
276        urlEncode(APP_SECRET_PROOF_PARAM_NAME), obtainAppSecretProof(accessToken, appSecret)), null);
277      connectionJson = makeRequestAndProcessResponse(() -> webRequestor.executeGet(request));
278    } else {
279      connectionJson = makeRequestAndProcessResponse(
280        () -> webRequestor.executeGet(new WebRequestor.Request(connectionPageUrl, getHeaderAccessToken())));
281    }
282
283    return new Connection<>(this, connectionJson, connectionType);
284  }
285
286  /**
287   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#fetchObject(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class, com.restfb.Parameter[])
288   */
289  @Override
290  public <T> T fetchObject(String object, Class<T> objectType, Parameter... parameters) {
291    verifyParameterPresence("object", object);
292    verifyParameterPresence("objectType", objectType);
293    return jsonMapper.toJavaObject(makeRequest(object, parameters), objectType);
294  }
295
296  @Override
297  public FacebookClient createClientWithAccessToken(String accessToken) {
298    return new DefaultFacebookClient(accessToken, this.appSecret, this.apiVersion);
299  }
300
301  /**
302   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#fetchObjects(java.util.List, java.lang.Class, com.restfb.Parameter[])
303   */
304  @Override
305  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
306  public <T> T fetchObjects(List<String> ids, Class<T> objectType, Parameter... parameters) {
307    verifyParameterPresence("ids", ids);
308    verifyParameterPresence("connectionType", objectType);
309    requireNotEmpty(ids, "The list of IDs cannot be empty.");
310
311    if (Stream.of(parameters).anyMatch(p -> IDS_PARAM_NAME.equals(p.name))) {
312      throw new IllegalArgumentException("You cannot specify the '" + IDS_PARAM_NAME + "' URL parameter yourself - "
313          + "RestFB will populate this for you with the list of IDs you passed to this method.");
314    }
315
316    JsonArray idArray = new JsonArray();
317
318    // Normalize the IDs
319    for (String id : ids) {
320      throwIAEonBlankId(id);
321      idArray.add(id.trim());
322    }
323
324    try {
325      String jsonString = makeRequest("",
326        parametersWithAdditionalParameter(Parameter.with(IDS_PARAM_NAME, idArray.toString()), parameters));
327
328      return jsonMapper.toJavaObject(jsonString, objectType);
329    } catch (ParseException e) {
330      throw new FacebookJsonMappingException("Unable to map connection JSON to Java objects", e);
331    }
332  }
333
334  private void throwIAEonBlankId(String id) {
335    if (StringUtils.isBlank(id)) {
336      throw new IllegalArgumentException("The list of IDs cannot contain blank strings.");
337    }
338  }
339
340  /**
341   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#publish(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class, com.restfb.BinaryAttachment,
342   *      com.restfb.Parameter[])
343   */
344  @Override
345  public <T> T publish(String connection, Class<T> objectType, List<BinaryAttachment> binaryAttachments,
346      Parameter... parameters) {
347    verifyParameterPresence("connection", connection);
348
349    return jsonMapper.toJavaObject(makeRequest(connection, true, false, binaryAttachments, parameters), objectType);
350  }
351
352  /**
353   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#publish(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class, com.restfb.BinaryAttachment,
354   *      com.restfb.Parameter[])
355   */
356  @Override
357  public <T> T publish(String connection, Class<T> objectType, BinaryAttachment binaryAttachment,
358      Parameter... parameters) {
359    List<BinaryAttachment> attachments =
360        Optional.ofNullable(binaryAttachment).map(Collections::singletonList).orElse(null);
361    return publish(connection, objectType, attachments, parameters);
362  }
363
364  /**
365   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#publish(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class, com.restfb.Parameter[])
366   */
367  @Override
368  public <T> T publish(String connection, Class<T> objectType, Parameter... parameters) {
369    return publish(connection, objectType, (List<BinaryAttachment>) null, parameters);
370  }
371
372  @Override
373  public String getLogoutUrl(String next) {
374    String parameterString;
375    if (next != null) {
376      Parameter p = Parameter.with("next", next);
377      parameterString = toParameterString(false, p);
378    } else {
379      parameterString = toParameterString(false);
380    }
381
382    final String fullEndPoint = createEndpointForApiCall("logout.php", false);
383    return fullEndPoint + "?" + parameterString;
384  }
385
386  /**
387   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#executeBatch(com.restfb.batch.BatchRequest[])
388   */
389  @Override
390  public List<BatchResponse> executeBatch(BatchRequest... batchRequests) {
391    return executeBatch(asList(batchRequests), Collections.emptyList());
392  }
393
394  /**
395   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#executeBatch(java.util.List)
396   */
397  @Override
398  public List<BatchResponse> executeBatch(List<BatchRequest> batchRequests) {
399    return executeBatch(batchRequests, Collections.emptyList());
400  }
401
402  /**
403   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#executeBatch(java.util.List, java.util.List)
404   */
405  @Override
406  public List<BatchResponse> executeBatch(List<BatchRequest> batchRequests, List<BinaryAttachment> binaryAttachments) {
407    verifyParameterPresence("binaryAttachments", binaryAttachments);
408    requireNotEmpty(batchRequests, "You must specify at least one batch request.");
409
410    return jsonMapper.toJavaList(
411      makeRequest("", true, false, binaryAttachments, Parameter.with("batch", jsonMapper.toJson(batchRequests, true))),
412      BatchResponse.class);
413  }
414
415  /**
416   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#convertSessionKeysToAccessTokens(java.lang.String, java.lang.String,
417   *      java.lang.String[])
418   */
419  @Override
420  public List<AccessToken> convertSessionKeysToAccessTokens(String appId, String secretKey, String... sessionKeys) {
421    verifyParameterPresence(APP_ID, appId);
422    verifyParameterPresence("secretKey", secretKey);
423
424    if (sessionKeys == null || sessionKeys.length == 0) {
425      return emptyList();
426    }
427
428    String json = makeRequest("/oauth/exchange_sessions", true, false, null, Parameter.with(CLIENT_ID, appId),
429      Parameter.with(PARAM_CLIENT_SECRET, secretKey), Parameter.with("sessions", String.join(",", sessionKeys)));
430
431    return jsonMapper.toJavaList(json, AccessToken.class);
432  }
433
434  /**
435   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#obtainAppAccessToken(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
436   */
437  @Override
438  public AccessToken obtainAppAccessToken(String appId, String appSecret) {
439    verifyParameterPresence(APP_ID, appId);
440    verifyParameterPresence(APP_SECRET, appSecret);
441
442    String response = makeRequest("oauth/access_token", Parameter.with("grant_type", "client_credentials"),
443      Parameter.with(CLIENT_ID, appId), Parameter.with(PARAM_CLIENT_SECRET, appSecret));
444
445    try {
446      return getAccessTokenFromResponse(response);
447    } catch (Exception t) {
448      throw new FacebookResponseContentException(CANNOT_EXTRACT_ACCESS_TOKEN_MESSAGE, t);
449    }
450  }
451
452  @Override
453  public DeviceCode fetchDeviceCode(ScopeBuilder scope) {
454    verifyParameterPresence(SCOPE, scope);
455    ObjectUtil.requireNotNull(accessToken,
456      () -> new IllegalStateException("access token is required to fetch a device access token"));
457
458    String response = makeRequest("device/login", true, false, null, Parameter.with("type", "device_code"),
459      Parameter.with(SCOPE, scope.toString()));
460    return jsonMapper.toJavaObject(response, DeviceCode.class);
461  }
462
463  @Override
464  public AccessToken obtainDeviceAccessToken(String code) throws FacebookDeviceTokenCodeExpiredException,
465      FacebookDeviceTokenPendingException, FacebookDeviceTokenDeclinedException, FacebookDeviceTokenSlowdownException {
466    verifyParameterPresence("code", code);
467
468    ObjectUtil.requireNotNull(accessToken,
469      () -> new IllegalStateException("access token is required to fetch a device access token"));
470
471    try {
472      String response = makeRequest("device/login_status", true, false, null, Parameter.with("type", "device_token"),
473        Parameter.with("code", code));
474      return getAccessTokenFromResponse(response);
475    } catch (FacebookOAuthException foae) {
476      DeviceTokenExceptionFactory.createFrom(foae);
477      return null;
478    }
479  }
480
481  /**
482   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#obtainUserAccessToken(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String,
483   *      java.lang.String)
484   */
485  @Override
486  public AccessToken obtainUserAccessToken(String appId, String appSecret, String redirectUri,
487      String verificationCode) {
488    verifyParameterPresence(APP_ID, appId);
489    verifyParameterPresence(APP_SECRET, appSecret);
490    verifyParameterPresence("verificationCode", verificationCode);
491
492    String response = makeRequest("oauth/access_token", Parameter.with(CLIENT_ID, appId),
493      Parameter.with(PARAM_CLIENT_SECRET, appSecret), Parameter.with("code", verificationCode),
494      Parameter.with("redirect_uri", redirectUri));
495
496    try {
497      return getAccessTokenFromResponse(response);
498    } catch (Exception t) {
499      throw new FacebookResponseContentException(CANNOT_EXTRACT_ACCESS_TOKEN_MESSAGE, t);
500    }
501  }
502
503  /**
504   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#obtainExtendedAccessToken(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
505   */
506  @Override
507  public AccessToken obtainExtendedAccessToken(String appId, String appSecret) {
508    ObjectUtil.requireNotNull(accessToken,
509      () -> new IllegalStateException(
510        format("You cannot call this method because you did not construct this instance of %s with an access token.",
511          getClass().getSimpleName())));
512
513    return obtainExtendedAccessToken(appId, appSecret, accessToken);
514  }
515
516  /**
517   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#obtainExtendedAccessToken(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
518   */
519  @Override
520  public AccessToken obtainExtendedAccessToken(String appId, String appSecret, String accessToken) {
521    verifyParameterPresence(APP_ID, appId);
522    verifyParameterPresence(APP_SECRET, appSecret);
523    verifyParameterPresence("accessToken", accessToken);
524
525    String response = makeRequest("/oauth/access_token", false, false, null, Parameter.with(CLIENT_ID, appId),
526      Parameter.with(PARAM_CLIENT_SECRET, appSecret), Parameter.with("grant_type", "fb_exchange_token"),
527      Parameter.with("fb_exchange_token", accessToken));
528
529    try {
530      return getAccessTokenFromResponse(response);
531    } catch (Exception t) {
532      throw new FacebookResponseContentException(CANNOT_EXTRACT_ACCESS_TOKEN_MESSAGE, t);
533    }
534  }
535
536  private AccessToken getAccessTokenFromResponse(String response) {
537    AccessToken token;
538    try {
539      token = getJsonMapper().toJavaObject(response, AccessToken.class);
540    } catch (FacebookJsonMappingException fjme) {
541      CLIENT_LOGGER.trace("could not map response to access token class try to fetch directly from String", fjme);
542      token = AccessToken.fromQueryString(response);
543    }
544    token.setClient(createClientWithAccessToken(token.getAccessToken()));
545    return token;
546  }
547
548  @Override
549  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
550  public <T> T parseSignedRequest(String signedRequest, String appSecret, Class<T> objectType) {
551    verifyParameterPresence("signedRequest", signedRequest);
552    verifyParameterPresence(APP_SECRET, appSecret);
553    verifyParameterPresence("objectType", objectType);
554
555    String[] signedRequestTokens = signedRequest.split("[.]");
556
557    if (signedRequestTokens.length != 2) {
558      throw new FacebookSignedRequestParsingException(format(
559        "Signed request '%s' is expected to be signature and payload strings separated by a '.'", signedRequest));
560    }
561
562    String encodedSignature = signedRequestTokens[0];
563    String urlDecodedSignature = urlDecodeSignedRequestToken(encodedSignature);
564    byte[] signature = decodeBase64(urlDecodedSignature);
565
566    String encodedPayload = signedRequestTokens[1];
567    String urlDecodedPayload = urlDecodeSignedRequestToken(encodedPayload);
568    String payload = StringUtils.toString(decodeBase64(urlDecodedPayload));
569
570    // Convert payload to a JsonObject so we can pull algorithm data out of it
571    JsonObject payloadObject = getJsonMapper().toJavaObject(payload, JsonObject.class);
572
573    if (!payloadObject.contains("algorithm")) {
574      throw new FacebookSignedRequestParsingException("Unable to detect algorithm used for signed request");
575    }
576
577    String algorithm = payloadObject.getString("algorithm", null);
578
579    if (!verifySignedRequest(appSecret, algorithm, encodedPayload, signature)) {
580      throw new FacebookSignedRequestVerificationException(
581        "Signed request verification failed. Are you sure the request was made for the app identified by the app secret you provided?");
582    }
583
584    // Marshal to the user's preferred type.
585    // If the user asked for a JsonObject, send back the one we already parsed.
586    return objectType.equals(JsonObject.class) ? (T) payloadObject : getJsonMapper().toJavaObject(payload, objectType);
587  }
588
589  /**
590   * Decodes a component of a signed request received from Facebook using FB's special URL-encoding strategy.
591   * 
592   * @param signedRequestToken
593   *          Token to decode.
594   * @return The decoded token.
595   */
596  protected String urlDecodeSignedRequestToken(String signedRequestToken) {
597    verifyParameterPresence("signedRequestToken", signedRequestToken);
598    return signedRequestToken.replace("-", "+").replace("_", "/").trim();
599  }
600
601  @Override
602  public String getLoginDialogUrl(String appId, String redirectUri, ScopeBuilder scope, Parameter... parameters) {
603    verifyParameterPresence(APP_ID, appId);
604    verifyParameterPresence("redirectUri", redirectUri);
605    verifyParameterPresence(SCOPE, scope);
606
607    String dialogUrl = getFacebookEndpointUrls().getFacebookEndpoint() + "/dialog/oauth";
608
609    List<Parameter> parameterList = new ArrayList<>();
610    parameterList.add(Parameter.with(CLIENT_ID, appId));
611    parameterList.add(Parameter.with("redirect_uri", redirectUri));
612    parameterList.add(Parameter.with(SCOPE, scope.toString()));
613
614    // add optional parameters
615    Collections.addAll(parameterList, parameters);
616
617    return dialogUrl + "?" + toParameterString(false, parameterList.toArray(new Parameter[0]));
618  }
619
620  /**
621   * Verifies that the signed request is really from Facebook.
622   * 
623   * @param appSecret
624   *          The secret for the app that can verify this signed request.
625   * @param algorithm
626   *          Signature algorithm specified by FB in the decoded payload.
627   * @param encodedPayload
628   *          The encoded payload used to generate a signature for comparison against the provided {@code signature}.
629   * @param signature
630   *          The decoded signature extracted from the signed request. Compared against a signature generated from
631   *          {@code encodedPayload}.
632   * @return {@code true} if the signed request is verified, {@code false} if not.
633   */
634  protected boolean verifySignedRequest(String appSecret, String algorithm, String encodedPayload, byte[] signature) {
635    verifyParameterPresence(APP_SECRET, appSecret);
636    verifyParameterPresence("algorithm", algorithm);
637    verifyParameterPresence("encodedPayload", encodedPayload);
638    verifyParameterPresence("signature", signature);
639
640    // Normalize algorithm name...FB calls it differently than Java does
641    if ("HMAC-SHA256".equalsIgnoreCase(algorithm)) {
642      algorithm = "HMACSHA256";
643    }
644
645    try {
646      Mac mac = Mac.getInstance(algorithm);
647      mac.init(new SecretKeySpec(toBytes(appSecret), algorithm));
648      byte[] payloadSignature = mac.doFinal(toBytes(encodedPayload));
649      return Arrays.equals(signature, payloadSignature);
650    } catch (Exception e) {
651      throw new FacebookSignedRequestVerificationException("Unable to perform signed request verification", e);
652    }
653  }
654
655  /**
656   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#debugToken(java.lang.String)
657   */
658  @Override
659  public DebugTokenInfo debugToken(String inputToken) {
660    verifyParameterPresence("inputToken", inputToken);
661    String response = makeRequest("/debug_token", Parameter.with("input_token", inputToken));
662
663    try {
664      JsonObject json = Json.parse(response).asObject();
665      JsonObject data = json.get("data").asObject();
666      return getJsonMapper().toJavaObject(data.toString(), DebugTokenInfo.class);
667    } catch (Exception t) {
668      throw new FacebookResponseContentException("Unable to parse JSON from response.", t);
669    }
670  }
671
672  /**
673   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#getJsonMapper()
674   */
675  @Override
676  public JsonMapper getJsonMapper() {
677    return jsonMapper;
678  }
679
680  /**
681   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#getWebRequestor()
682   */
683  @Override
684  public WebRequestor getWebRequestor() {
685    return webRequestor;
686  }
687
688  /**
689   * Coordinates the process of executing the API request GET/POST and processing the response we receive from the
690   * endpoint.
691   * 
692   * @param endpoint
693   *          Facebook Graph API endpoint.
694   * @param parameters
695   *          Arbitrary number of parameters to send along to Facebook as part of the API call.
696   * @return The JSON returned by Facebook for the API call.
697   * @throws FacebookException
698   *           If an error occurs while making the Facebook API POST or processing the response.
699   */
700  protected String makeRequest(String endpoint, Parameter... parameters) {
701    return makeRequest(endpoint, false, false, null, parameters);
702  }
703
704  /**
705   * Coordinates the process of executing the API request GET/POST and processing the response we receive from the
706   * endpoint.
707   * 
708   * @param endpoint
709   *          Facebook Graph API endpoint.
710   * @param executeAsPost
711   *          {@code true} to execute the web request as a {@code POST}, {@code false} to execute as a {@code GET}.
712   * @param executeAsDelete
713   *          {@code true} to add a special 'treat this request as a {@code DELETE}' parameter.
714   * @param binaryAttachments
715   *          A list of binary files to include in a {@code POST} request. Pass {@code null} if no attachment should be
716   *          sent.
717   * @param parameters
718   *          Arbitrary number of parameters to send along to Facebook as part of the API call.
719   * @return The JSON returned by Facebook for the API call.
720   * @throws FacebookException
721   *           If an error occurs while making the Facebook API POST or processing the response.
722   */
723  protected String makeRequest(String endpoint, final boolean executeAsPost, final boolean executeAsDelete,
724      final List<BinaryAttachment> binaryAttachments, Parameter... parameters) {
725    verifyParameterLegality(parameters);
726
727    if (executeAsDelete && isHttpDeleteFallback()) {
728      parameters = parametersWithAdditionalParameter(Parameter.with(METHOD_PARAM_NAME, "delete"), parameters);
729    }
730
731    if (!endpoint.startsWith("/")) {
732      endpoint = "/" + endpoint;
733    }
734
735    final String fullEndpoint =
736        createEndpointForApiCall(endpoint, binaryAttachments != null && !binaryAttachments.isEmpty());
737    final String parameterString = toParameterString(parameters);
738
739    return makeRequestAndProcessResponse(() -> {
740      WebRequestor.Request request = new WebRequestor.Request(fullEndpoint, getHeaderAccessToken(), parameterString);
741      if (executeAsDelete && !isHttpDeleteFallback()) {
742        return webRequestor.executeDelete(request);
743      }
744
745      if (executeAsPost) {
746        request.setBinaryAttachments(binaryAttachments);
747        return webRequestor.executePost(request);
748      }
749
750      return webRequestor.executeGet(request);
751    });
752  }
753
754  private String getHeaderAccessToken() {
755    if (accessTokenInHeader) {
756      return this.accessToken;
757    }
758
759    return null;
760  }
761
762  /**
763   * @see com.restfb.FacebookClient#obtainAppSecretProof(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
764   */
765  @Override
766  public String obtainAppSecretProof(String accessToken, String appSecret) {
767    verifyParameterPresence("accessToken", accessToken);
768    verifyParameterPresence(APP_SECRET, appSecret);
769    return EncodingUtils.encodeAppSecretProof(appSecret, accessToken);
770  }
771
772  /**
773   * returns if the fallback post method (<code>true</code>) is used or the http delete (<code>false</code>)
774   * 
775   * @return {@code true} if POST is used instead of HTTP DELETE (default)
776   */
777  public boolean isHttpDeleteFallback() {
778    return httpDeleteFallback;
779  }
780
781  /**
782   * Set to <code>true</code> if the facebook http delete fallback should be used. Facebook allows to use the http POST
783   * with the parameter "method=delete" to override the post and use delete instead. This feature allow http client that
784   * do not support the whole http method set, to delete objects from facebook
785   * 
786   * @param httpDeleteFallback
787   *          <code>true</code> if the the http Delete Fallback is used
788   */
789  public void setHttpDeleteFallback(boolean httpDeleteFallback) {
790    this.httpDeleteFallback = httpDeleteFallback;
791  }
792
793  protected interface Requestor {
794    Response makeRequest() throws IOException;
795  }
796
797  protected String makeRequestAndProcessResponse(Requestor requestor) {
798    Response response;
799
800    // Perform a GET or POST to the API endpoint
801    try {
802      response = requestor.makeRequest();
803    } catch (Exception t) {
804      throw new FacebookNetworkException(t);
805    }
806
807    // If we get any HTTP response code other than a 200 OK or 400 Bad Request
808    // or 401 Not Authorized or 403 Forbidden or 404 Not Found or 500 Internal
809    // Server Error or 302 Not Modified
810    // throw an exception.
811    if (HTTP_OK != response.getStatusCode() && HTTP_BAD_REQUEST != response.getStatusCode()
812        && HTTP_UNAUTHORIZED != response.getStatusCode() && HTTP_NOT_FOUND != response.getStatusCode()
813        && HTTP_INTERNAL_ERROR != response.getStatusCode() && HTTP_FORBIDDEN != response.getStatusCode()
814        && HTTP_NOT_MODIFIED != response.getStatusCode()) {
815      throw new FacebookNetworkException(response.getStatusCode());
816    }
817
818    String json = response.getBody();
819
820    try {
821      // If the response contained an error code, throw an exception.
822      getFacebookExceptionGenerator().throwFacebookResponseStatusExceptionIfNecessary(json, response.getStatusCode());
823    } catch (FacebookErrorMessageException feme) {
824      Optional.ofNullable(getWebRequestor()).map(WebRequestor::getDebugHeaderInfo).ifPresent(feme::setDebugHeaderInfo);
825      throw feme;
826    }
827
828    // If there was no response error information and this was a 500 or 401
829    // error, something weird happened on Facebook's end. Bail.
830    if (HTTP_INTERNAL_ERROR == response.getStatusCode() || HTTP_UNAUTHORIZED == response.getStatusCode()) {
831      throw new FacebookNetworkException(response.getStatusCode());
832    }
833
834    return json;
835  }
836
837  /**
838   * Generate the parameter string to be included in the Facebook API request.
839   * 
840   * @param parameters
841   *          Arbitrary number of extra parameters to include in the request.
842   * @return The parameter string to include in the Facebook API request.
843   * @throws FacebookJsonMappingException
844   *           If an error occurs when building the parameter string.
845   */
846  protected String toParameterString(Parameter... parameters) {
847    return toParameterString(true, parameters);
848  }
849
850  /**
851   * Generate the parameter string to be included in the Facebook API request.
852   * 
853   * @param withJsonParameter
854   *          add additional parameter format with type json
855   * @param parameters
856   *          Arbitrary number of extra parameters to include in the request.
857   * @return The parameter string to include in the Facebook API request.
858   * @throws FacebookJsonMappingException
859   *           If an error occurs when building the parameter string.
860   */
861  protected String toParameterString(boolean withJsonParameter, Parameter... parameters) {
862    if (!isBlank(accessToken) && !accessTokenInHeader) {
863      parameters = parametersWithAdditionalParameter(Parameter.with(ACCESS_TOKEN_PARAM_NAME, accessToken), parameters);
864    }
865
866    if (!isBlank(accessToken) && !isBlank(appSecret)) {
867      parameters = parametersWithAdditionalParameter(
868        Parameter.with(APP_SECRET_PROOF_PARAM_NAME, obtainAppSecretProof(accessToken, appSecret)), parameters);
869    }
870
871    if (withJsonParameter) {
872      parameters = parametersWithAdditionalParameter(Parameter.with(FORMAT_PARAM_NAME, "json"), parameters);
873    }
874
875    return Stream.of(parameters).map(p -> urlEncode(p.name) + "=" + urlEncodedValueForParameterName(p.name, p.value))
876      .collect(Collectors.joining("&"));
877  }
878
879  /**
880   * @see com.restfb.BaseFacebookClient#createEndpointForApiCall(java.lang.String,boolean)
881   */
882  @Override
883  protected String createEndpointForApiCall(String apiCall, boolean hasAttachment) {
884    while (apiCall.startsWith("/"))
885      apiCall = apiCall.substring(1);
886
887    String baseUrl = getFacebookGraphEndpointUrl();
888
889    if (hasAttachment && (apiCall.endsWith("/videos") || apiCall.endsWith("/advideos"))) {
890      baseUrl = getFacebookGraphVideoEndpointUrl();
891    } else if (apiCall.endsWith("logout.php")) {
892      baseUrl = getFacebookEndpointUrls().getFacebookEndpoint();
893    }
894
895    return format("%s/%s", baseUrl, apiCall);
896  }
897
898  /**
899   * Returns the base endpoint URL for the Graph API.
900   * 
901   * @return The base endpoint URL for the Graph API.
902   */
903  protected String getFacebookGraphEndpointUrl() {
904    if (apiVersion.isUrlElementRequired()) {
905      return getFacebookEndpointUrls().getGraphEndpoint() + '/' + apiVersion.getUrlElement();
906    } else {
907      return getFacebookEndpointUrls().getGraphEndpoint();
908    }
909  }
910
911  /**
912   * Returns the base endpoint URL for the Graph API's video upload functionality.
913   * 
914   * @return The base endpoint URL for the Graph API's video upload functionality.
915   * @since 1.6.5
916   */
917  protected String getFacebookGraphVideoEndpointUrl() {
918    if (apiVersion.isUrlElementRequired()) {
919      return getFacebookEndpointUrls().getGraphVideoEndpoint() + '/' + apiVersion.getUrlElement();
920    } else {
921      return getFacebookEndpointUrls().getGraphVideoEndpoint();
922    }
923  }
924
925  public FacebookEndpoints getFacebookEndpointUrls() {
926    return facebookEndpointUrls;
927  }
928
929  public void setFacebookEndpointUrls(FacebookEndpoints facebookEndpointUrls) {
930    this.facebookEndpointUrls = facebookEndpointUrls;
931  }
932}
